name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM 7th Edition T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension. AJCC 7th Edition includes a T3 category for head and neck skin primaries only.

**Note 2:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 3:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category. 

**Note 4:**  The assignment of the T1 category for cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas with one or no high-risk features is based on tumor size.  A physician's statement of the T1 category may be used to code both tumor size and/or primary tumor if this is the only information in the medical record regarding one or both of these fields. The two fields are coded separately though.
rows: Tumor more than 2 cm in greatest dimension

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Lesion(s) confined to dermis
Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)
Underlying cartilage and/or skeletal muscle

Stated as T1
